Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.21.2509;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b\f0\fs20 There are several events that can be used to mark records quickly. Most of these are set to keyboard shortcuts, but you can also raise them internally. Both methods are used in this example.\par \par In this example, you can experiment with marking records in a table, using the shortcut keys:\par \par Next Line Mark:\cf2 Shift+Down\cf1\par Prev Line Mark: \cf2 Shift+Up\par \cf1\par Mark Next Page: \cf2 Shift+PgDn\cf1\par Mark Prev Page: \cf2 Shift+PgUp\par \cf1\par Mark All: \cf2 Ctrl+A\par \cf1 Unmark All: \cf2 Ctrl+Space\par \par \cf1 Move to the Next Row in MM:\cf2 Ctrl+Down\cf1\par Move to the Prev Row in MM: \cf2 Ctrl+Up\par \cf1\par Move to the Next Row in MM: \cf2 Ctrl+PgDn\cf1\par Move to the Prev Row in MM: \cf2 Ctrl+PgUp\cf1\par }

Text.val: Here we process the selected records.
Reset the selected fields. This only executes once, as the last record is processed.
